intro: Ochrocodon pudicus, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. Ochrocodon pudicus is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils.
